Posts.Content: Mar 13, 2009 07:39PM Artladyblue wrote: Dear Kimf - thank you for your post - I have a suspicious micro calc cluster with a braid - 4...deep in the chest wall - naturally freaked out so I am going to Sloan Kettering this Monday to see about them doing a biopsy and treatment if needed. I live in the Catskills and it will be well over 2 hour drive each way. Most people think I am crazy and want me to go local. Where I live there is only 1 breast surgeon and she is all booked up. Plus if it is malignant I feel I want the "best", and know that I will try everything that is top notch and up to date. I was/am so discouraged to see so many negative comments about MSK and yes I have been hearing that for many years...but I just felt that I needed the best up to date info and treatment.  My question to you is, is it doable to live hours away and yet go there for treatment? In my heart I do feel I have "something"...and the radiologist told me to "prepare". But I live alone and I am newly moved to this area so I have no good friends established yet who I could count on for driving, etc. I am feeling discouraged by the comments about MSK so I was thankful to hear yours...what was your treatment and how were  you able to organize that when you lived 3 hours away??? Thank You - Bonnie :>) (Artladyblue)
Posts.Title: Sloan-Kettering KATIEKAY Hortense
